      • changeUserPasswordForId

        public Database.PasswordChangeResult changeUserPasswordForId(long id,
                                                    java.lang.String oldPassword,
                                                    java.lang.String newPassword)
        Changes the password for the user identified by the given ID stored in the database. The function returns PasswordChangeResult.Success for successful password change and PasswordChangeResult.Error otherwise.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the user for whom the password should be changed
        oldPassword - The old password of the user
        newPassword - The new password of the user
        Returns:
        Result of the password change

      • getMD5Hash

        public java.lang.String getMD5Hash(java.io.File file)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Returns an MD5 hash for the given file. The hash is computed upon the whole content of the file.
        Parameters:
        file - The object referencing to the file.
        Returns:
        The computed MD5 hash
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getDataSetByHash

        public java.util.List<JPADataSetLO> getDataSetByHash(java.lang.String hash)
        The function returns all DataSet entries in the database, which has an associated file with the same MD5 hash as given.
        Parameters:
        hash - The Hash whose occurences are we searching for.
        Returns:
        The list of found DataSet entries.

      • getSingleDataSetByHash

        public JPADataSetLO getSingleDataSetByHash(java.lang.String hash)
        Returns a DataSet object for the given file hash.
        Parameters:
        hash - The hash for we want the DataSet
        Returns:
        The object of the found dataset.

      • saveDataSet

        public JPADataSetLO saveDataSet(JPAUser user,
                       java.io.File dataSet,
                       java.lang.String description)
                         throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                java.io.IOException
        The function stores the given file to the Database as a DataSet through JPA. The dataset will be associated with the given user, description. Please note, that new dataset's MD5 hash will be compared to the already stored dataset's MD5 hashes and if there are matching entries in the database the LargeObject won't be created, but instead a link is being created.
        Parameters:
        user - The JPAUser object of the owner
        dataSet - The File object of the file to be stored.
        description - The description of the DataSet.
        Returns:
        The persisted JPADataSetLO object for the stored file
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.io.IOException

      • saveDataSet

        public JPADataSetLO saveDataSet(JPAUser user,
                       java.io.File dataSet,
                       java.lang.String description,
                       JPAGlobalMetaData globalMetaData)
                         throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                java.io.IOException
        The function stores the given file to the Database as a DataSet through JPA. The dataset will be associated with the given user, description. Please note, that new dataset's MD5 hash will be compared to the already stored dataset's MD5 hashes and if there are matching entries in the database the LargeObject won't be created, but instead a link is being created.
        Parameters:
        user - The JPAUser object of the owner
        dataSet - The File object of the file to be stored.
        description - The description of the DataSet.
        globalMetaData - The GlobalMetaData object containing global metadata information for the dataset
        Returns:
        The persisted JPADataSetLO object for the stored file
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.io.IOException

      • saveDataSet

        public JPADataSetLO saveDataSet(JPAUser user,
                       java.io.File dataSet,
                       java.lang.String description,
                       JPAGlobalMetaData globalMetaData,
                       java.util.List<JPAAttributeMetaData> attributeMetaData)
                         throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                java.io.IOException
        The function stores the given file to the Database as a DataSet through JPA. The dataset will be associated with the given user, description. Please note, that new dataset's MD5 hash will be compared to the already stored dataset's MD5 hashes and if there are matching entries in the database the LargeObject won't be created, but instead a link is being created.
        Parameters:
        user - The JPAUser object of the owner
        dataSet - The File object of the file to be stored.
        description - The description of the DataSet.
        globalMetaData - The JPAGlobalMetaData object containing global metadata information for the dataset
        attributeMetaData - The List object containing the list of attribute metadatas for the dataset for the dataset
        Returns:
        The persisted JPADataSetLO object for the stored file
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.io.IOException

      • saveFileAsLargeObject

        public long saveFileAsLargeObject(java.io.File file)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                  java.io.IOException
        This function stored the given File to the Postgre DB using Postgre's LargeObject method. It returns the ID of the created LargeObject, that can be used for referencing the stored file.
        Parameters:
        file - Object File representing the file to be stored.
        Returns:
        The Object ID of the LargeObject.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.io.IOException

      • deleteLargeObject

        public void deleteLargeObject(long oid)
                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        The function deletes the LargeObject with the given OID from the database.
        Parameters:
        oid - The Object ID of the LargeObject to be deleted.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getDataFromLargeObject

        public byte[] getDataFromLargeObject(long oid)
                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        The function returns the content of the stored LargeObject
        Parameters:
        oid - The Object ID of the stored LArgeObject
        Returns:
        The content of the stored file.
        Throws:

      • getLargeObjectReader

        public PostgreLargeObjectReader getLargeObjectReader(java.lang.String hash)
        Returns a PostgreLargeObjectReader object for the DataSet stored in the database, if there exists a dataset in the DB for the given hash.
        Parameters:
        hash - The hash of the dataset
        Returns:
        The Reader for the dataset in the database
